section.title: Introduction

note.para: Nagios is not designed to be a replacement for a full-blown &protocol-snmp; management application like HP OpenView or OpenNMS. However, you can set things up so that &protocol-snmp; traps received by a host on your network can generate alerts in Nagios.

section.para: As if designed to make the Gods of Hypocrisy die of laughter, &protocol-snmp; is anything but simple. Translating &protocol-snmp; traps and getting them into Nagios (as passive check results) can be a bit tedious. To make this task easier, I suggest you check out Alex Burger's &protocol-snmp; Trap Translator project located at http://www.snmptt.org. When combined with Net-&protocol-snmp;, SNMPTT provides an enhanced trap handling system that can be integrated with Nagios.
